Review_Description: Roasty-sweet, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, roasted almond, gently scorched oak, shortbread cookie, narcissus in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate, scorched oak, and almond.
Blind Assessment: Roasty-sweet, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, roasted almond, gently scorched oak, shortbread cookie, narcissus in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate, scorched oak, and almond.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Kulatik Cooperative, from trees of the Typica, Bourbon and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Regent strives to deliver coffee with care and purpose. Visit regentcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A deep-toned Chiapas cup with a throughline of crisp chocolate and almond, roast-rounded and sweet.

Review_Description: High-toned, lush, complexly fruity. Lychee, starfruit, wisteria, lemon thyme, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet with elegant, balanced acidity; lyrically silky mouthfeel. Notes of lychee, wisteria and cocoa nib carry far into a long, lingering finish.
Blind Assessment: High-toned, lush, complexly fruity. Lychee, starfruit, wisteria, lemon thyme, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet with elegant, balanced acidity; lyrically silky mouthfeel. Notes of lychee, wisteria and cocoa nib carry far into a long, lingering finish.
Notes: Produced by Juan Peña of Finca La Papaya, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit jbccoffeeroasters.com or call 608-256-5282 for more information
Bottom Line: A fine example of what a Geisha natural from Ecuador can achieve: stunning aromatics, lush complexity throughout the profile, and fruit-forward with finesse.

Review_Description: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly tart, richly bright. Pomegranate, dark chocolate, narcissus, tangerine zest, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Crisp, satiny mouthfeel, chocolaty, fruit-tart finish. In cappuccino-scaled milk, pomegranate and dark chocolate notes are juxtaposed with narcissus.
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly tart, richly bright. Pomegranate, dark chocolate, narcissus, tangerine zest, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Crisp, satiny mouthfeel, chocolaty, fruit-tart finish. In cappuccino-scaled milk, pomegranate and dark chocolate notes are juxtaposed with narcissus.
Notes: A blend of Arabica coffees from Brazil, Thailand, and Nicaragua, and a Robusta from Ecuador, roasted for espresso applications. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit paradiseroasters.com or call 763-433-0626 for more information.
Bottom Line: A trifecta of tart fruit, deep chocolate and spicy floral notes, this espresso blend offers further intrigue with its successful inclusion of a Robusta component. Especially rich in cappuccino format.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Tolima Finca El Vergel Rebel Geisha
Review_Description: Complex, multi-layered. Green oolong, rosehips, sandalwood, gingko, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and and cup. Exceptionally sweet with elegant acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Richly resonant, sweetly tart finish.
Blind Assessment: Complex, multi-layered. Green oolong, rosehips, sandalwood, gingko, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and and cup. Exceptionally sweet with elegant acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Richly resonant, sweetly tart finish.
Notes: Produced by Marta Bayter and her sons, Shady and Elias, of Vergel Estate. Composed entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey or semi-washed method, in which the skins are removed from the fruit but some of the fruit flesh is allowed to dry on the beans. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit https://shopee.tw/iamjiter for more information.
Bottom Line: An enticingly rich Colombia Geisha aromatic fireworks whose promise is fulfilled in the cup with deep oolong-like impulses and sweet citrus zest.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Buenos Aires Honey Process-Yellow Velvet Peach
Review_Description: Fruit-toned, tropical. Strawberry-guava, freesia, ginseng, elm, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Vibrantly sweet, juicy acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, complex finish that leads with ginseng notes, followed by cocoa nib.
Blind Assessment: Fruit-toned, tropical. Strawberry-guava, freesia, ginseng, elm, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Vibrantly sweet, juicy acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, complex finish that leads with ginseng notes, followed by cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced at Finca Buenos Aires, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in an oxygen-free environment before drying, in this case, with the addition of peaches to the fermentation.  Ingenuity Coffee Roastery is a specialty coffee roaster based in Changhua, Taiwan. Visit https://shopee.tw/etmax123 for more information.
Bottom Line: A powerfully aromatic, flavor-saturated, experimentally processed Colombia cup that has been co-fermented with peaches.

Review_Description: Tropical-fruity, richly aromatic. Guava, passionflower, tangerine zest, macadamia nut, marjoram in aroma and cup. Complexly layered with punchy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Sweet herb notes highlight a long, savory finish.
Blind Assessment: Tropical-fruity, richly aromatic. Guava, passionflower, tangerine zest, macadamia nut, marjoram in aroma and cup. Complexly layered with punchy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Sweet herb notes highlight a long, savory finish.
Notes: A blend of two coffees: a double-anaerobic washed Costa Rica Catuai and a natural-processed Ethiopia Geisha. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit https://shopee.tw/iamjiter for more information.
Bottom Line: An unabashedly fruit-forward Costa Rica/Ethiopia blend that achieves balance and depth from sweet herb and citrus zest.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Sidama Arbegona Duwancho Cooperative G1
Review_Description: Sweetly savory, rich-toned. Pipe tobacco, golden raisin, lilac, almond, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet structure with winy acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. The finish centers on notes of golden raisin and pipe tobacco.
Blind Assessment: Sweetly savory, rich-toned. Pipe tobacco, golden raisin, lilac, almond, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet structure with winy acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. The finish centers on notes of golden raisin and pipe tobacco.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Duwancho Cooperative,  from trees of the 74110, 74112 and 74158 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the black honey method, in which the skins are removed from the fruit but virtually all of the fruit flesh is allowed to dry slowly on the beans, often resulting in a deep, pungent profile. Ingenuity Coffee Roastery is a specialty coffee roaster based in Changhua, Taiwan. Visit https://shopee.tw/etmax123 for more information.
Bottom Line: An inviting black honey-processed Ethiopia — rich, round, deeply aromatic.

Review_Description: Evaluated as espresso. Deep-toned, sweet-savory. Tamarind, dark chocolate, lemon verbena, cedar, narcissus in aroma and small cup. Crisply satiny mouthfeel; tart-leaning, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, nicely balanced between sweet and tart.
Coffee Origin: Mt. Kilimanjaro growing region, northern Tanzania
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deep-toned, sweet-savory. Tamarind, dark chocolate, lemon verbena, cedar, narcissus in aroma and small cup. Crisply satiny mouthfeel; tart-leaning, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, nicely balanced between sweet and tart.
Notes: A washed Tanzania from an undisclosed farm. Bathe in the Moonlight Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taibung, Taiwan. Visit www.instagram.com/bathein.moonlight/ for more information.
Bottom Line: A single-origin Tanzania espresso that offers tart fruit, sweet chocolate, and spicy floral notes in both the straight shot and in milk.

Review_Description: Sweetly nut-toned. Pecan butter, baking chocolate, orange zest, sassafras, nutmeg in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with mild acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to pecan and orange zest.
Blind Assessment: Sweetly nut-toned. Pecan butter, baking chocolate, orange zest, sassafras, nutmeg in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with mild acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to pecan and orange zest.
Notes: Produced by Agrocomercial Santa Felisa, S.A., entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans while they dry. Riika Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster based in New Taipei City, Taiwan. Email [email protected] for more information.
Bottom Line: A friendly, nut-driven Guatemala cup with undertones of bittersweet citrus zest.

Review_Description: Crisp, richly sweet. Cocoa nib, dried nectarine, narcissus, hazelnut, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of cocoa-toned nectarine.
Coffee Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Crisp, richly sweet. Cocoa nib, dried nectarine, narcissus, hazelnut, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of cocoa-toned nectarine.
Notes: Produced by the Hassen family at their estate farm in the Guji Zone of southern Ethiopia from distinctive landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region. This is a dry-processed or “natural” version, meaning the beans were dried inside the fruit rather than after the fruit has been removed, as is the case with wet-processed or “washed” coffees. Jebena Coffees is a Dubai-based custom-built roasting facility with a temperature- and humidity-controlled storage area and a professional cupping lab. Jebena offers coffees for both retail and wholesale purchase, as well as coffee training at every level. Visit www.jebenacoffees.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A juicy-sweet, balanced Ethiopia natural characterized by bright stone fruit and cocoa nib throughout the profile.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Oreo cookie, finger lime, lychee, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Lively, brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. A hint of cumin surfaces in the cookie-sweet finish.
Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Oreo cookie, finger lime, lychee, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Lively, brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. A hint of cumin surfaces in the cookie-sweet finish.
Notes: A USDA-certified organic coffee from Cusco, Peru (San Fernando Cooperative), processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Wonderstate Coffee, formerly Kickapoo Coffee, is an award-winning roaster based in rural Wisconsin known for its commitment to guaranteeing higher pay for farmers and operating the country’s first 100% solar-powered roastery. Visit wonderstate.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A satisfying organic Peru with sweet chocolate and lime notes complicated by subtle spice tones.

Review_Description: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly nut-toned, crisply chocolaty. Almond brittle, baking chocolate, dried plum, orange zest, oak in aroma and small cup. Lightly satiny mouthfeel; nutty, cocoa-toned finish with a backgrounded oak suggestion. In cappuccino-scaled milk, sweet almond and crisp chocolate notes vie for center stage.
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly nut-toned, crisply chocolaty. Almond brittle, baking chocolate, dried plum, orange zest, oak in aroma and small cup. Lightly satiny mouthfeel; nutty, cocoa-toned finish with a backgrounded oak suggestion. In cappuccino-scaled milk, sweet almond and crisp chocolate notes vie for center stage.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Central and South America roasted for espresso. Founded in 1994, Coffee By Design is a specialty coffee roaster in Portland, Maine that also operates three coffee shops in Portland. For more information, visit www.coffeebydesign.com.
Bottom Line: A balanced, sweet-toned espresso blend roasted to just before second crack — richly and sweetly developed but without explicit roast notes.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Passionfruit, scorched sandalwood, violet, tangerine, cocoa powder in aroma and cup. Gentle but juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Honey-like, floral finish with legs.
Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Passionfruit, scorched sandalwood, violet, tangerine, cocoa powder in aroma and cup. Gentle but juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Honey-like, floral finish with legs.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). MK Coffee Roasters, a short walk from the Shulin train station in New Taipei City, specializes in high-quality roasted beans to take home and expertly brewed coffees to enjoy in the café. Visit www.mkcoffee.com.tw or e-mail [email protected] for more information.
Bottom Line: A big, resonant dark-roast Kenya that preserves origin character and offers up sweetly tart fruit, delicate floral and rich aromatic wood notes with a not-too-roasty edge.

Review_Description: Vibrant, deep, elegant. Grape jelly, roasted coconut, violet, scorched clove, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with tangy acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. Complex smoky-sweet finish with grape and scorched clove notes.
Coffee Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Vibrant, deep, elegant. Grape jelly, roasted coconut, violet, scorched clove, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with tangy acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. Complex smoky-sweet finish with grape and scorched clove notes.
Notes: SL34 and SL28 are varieties of Arabica famous for producing the great classic coffees of Kenya. Hula Daddy is a boutique coffee producer with farms at the 1,400- and 2,500-foot levels of the Mount Hualalai volcano near the northern end of the Kona growing district, above the town of Kailua-Kona. This SL34 coffee was produced at the higher-elevation Hula Daddy farm and processed with an anaerobic ferment step using commercial yeast. Visit www.huladaddy.com or call 808-327-9744 for more information.
Bottom Line: A mesmerizing darker-roasted Kona SL34 with brightly sweet fruit and delicate florals against a backdrop of richly aromatic scorched clove.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Geisha Lucy Station Dark Roast
Review_Description: Roasty-sweet, floral-toned. Honeysuckle, date, scorched birch, dark chocolate, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and cup. Crisp, juicy acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of lemon and honeysuckle.
Blind Assessment: Roasty-sweet, floral-toned. Honeysuckle, date, scorched birch, dark chocolate, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and cup. Crisp, juicy acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of lemon and honeysuckle.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans, and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit www.gkcoffee.com.tw or email [email protected]
Bottom Line: A surprisingly bright dark-roasted Ethiopia Gesha with a throughline of pretty florals and rich chocolate notes.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Geisha Lucy Station Dark Roast
Review_Description: Roasty-sweet, floral-toned. Honeysuckle, date, scorched birch, dark chocolate, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and cup. Crisp, juicy acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of lemon and honeysuckle.
Blind Assessment: Roasty-sweet, floral-toned. Honeysuckle, date, scorched birch, dark chocolate, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and cup. Crisp, juicy acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of lemon and honeysuckle.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans, and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit www.gkcoffee.com.tw or email [email protected]
Bottom Line: A surprisingly bright dark-roasted Ethiopia Gesha with a throughline of pretty florals and rich chocolate notes.

Review_Description: Chocolaty and sweetly herbaceous. Dark chocolate, dried peach, sage, narcissus, scorched cedar in aroma and cup. Complex sweet-savory structure with rich, balanced acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to smoky chocolate and sage notes.
Blind Assessment: Chocolaty and sweetly herbaceous. Dark chocolate, dried peach, sage, narcissus, scorched cedar in aroma and cup. Complex sweet-savory structure with rich, balanced acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to smoky chocolate and sage notes.
Notes: In addition to his retail roasting operation, Aroma Roast Coffees, Simon Hsieh also operates Soaring Phoenix Trading, a business focused on purpose-built commercial espresso blends and high-quality single-origin coffees. Customers can also visit the new showroom, Chateau Andy, in Taipei City. Visit facebook.com/4ArtsZeroDefectCoffees or call 886-0983-749876 for more information.
Bottom Line: A deeply satisfying, rich-toned, dark-roasted Kenya with smoky herb notes, dried stone fruit, and spicy florals.

Review_Description: Berry-toned, richly floral, chocolaty. Mulberry, dark chocolate, lily, scorched oak, a hint of brandy in aroma and cup. Bittersweet with round, juicy acidity; lightly syrupy, supple mouthfeel. Long, flavor-saturated finish, crisp and sweet.
Blind Assessment: Berry-toned, richly floral, chocolaty. Mulberry, dark chocolate, lily, scorched oak, a hint of brandy in aroma and cup. Bittersweet with round, juicy acidity; lightly syrupy, supple mouthfeel. Long, flavor-saturated finish, crisp and sweet.
Notes: Produced at Kenya Embu Guchinda Estate from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Roaster Yu Chih Hao is co-founder of Fumi Coffee, a roaster in Hsinchu, Taiwan, specializing in specialty coffee and homemade desserts. Visit https://m.facebook.com/fumicafe035586631/ for more information.
Bottom Line: A complex, rich-toned, moderately dark-roasted Kenya driven by dark berry fruit, deep chocolate, and sweet floral notes.

Review_Description: Cocoa-centric, gently spice-toned. Baking chocolate, pink peppercorn, orange blossom, dried blueberry, oak in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory with gently tart acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with undertones of dried blueberry.
Blind Assessment: Cocoa-centric, gently spice-toned. Baking chocolate, pink peppercorn, orange blossom, dried blueberry, oak in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory with gently tart acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with undertones of dried blueberry.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Gedeb and Halo Bariti cooperatives from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Founded by Brad Katz, a music lover and home coffee roaster, Bassline Coffee aims to offer something for every kind of coffee lover with roasts that bring out the inherent qualities of diverse green coffees. Visit www.basslinecoffee.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A multi-layered Ethiopia natural, vibrantly spice-toned and sweetly floral.

Review_Description: Richly bittersweet, fruity. Guava, walnut, kefir, scorched redwood, lemon curd in aroma and cup. Complex, sweet-savory structure with fruit-toned acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Crisply tart, nutty finish.
Blind Assessment: Richly bittersweet, fruity. Guava, walnut, kefir, scorched redwood, lemon curd in aroma and cup. Complex, sweet-savory structure with fruit-toned acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Crisply tart, nutty finish.
Notes: A blend composed of four coffees: two from Colombia, one washed and one honey processed; a natural Panama; and a washed Papua New Guinea. Balmy Day Coffee Office is a specialty nano-roastery based in Taoyuan, Taiwan. For more information, visit facebook.com/Balmydaycoffee.
Bottom Line: An exceptionally bright dark-roast coffee complicated by crisp nut and rich aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Richly fruit- and spice-toned. Blackberry, scorchy cardamom, cherry blossom, Graham cracker, cocoa powder in aroma and cup. Sweetly deep with lyrically bright acidity; lightly creamy mouthfeel. The crisp finish centers around cardamom and cocoa powder.
Blind Assessment: Richly fruit- and spice-toned. Blackberry, scorchy cardamom, cherry blossom, Graham cracker, cocoa powder in aroma and cup. Sweetly deep with lyrically bright acidity; lightly creamy mouthfeel. The crisp finish centers around cardamom and cocoa powder.
Notes: This version of Mokha Java is composed of 50% medium-dark washed Ethiopia (currently Tega Tula), 20% dark-roast Pacific Island coffee (currently PNG Siane Chimbu), 20% medium-light natural Ethiopia (currently Shantawene), and 10% light washed Ethiopia (currently Suke Quto). Speckled Ax is a roaster based in Portland, Maine, specializing in high-quality certified organic and small-lot coffees. The company roasts in a vintage wood-fired Petroncini roaster with the goal of highlighting each coffee’s best attributes. Visit www.speckledax.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A complex variation on the classic Mokha Java theme, in this case Ethiopia-heavy, with depth from a Papua New Guinea. Redolent with blackberry and cardamom.
