Review_Description: Evaluated as espresso. Balanced, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, chicory, lily, dried plum, roasted walnut in aroma and small cup. Satiny mouthfeel; gently drying nut-toned finish with chicory undertones. In three parts milk, richly bittersweet with chocolate and chicory impulses and a hint of lily.
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Balanced, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, chicory, lily, dried plum, roasted walnut in aroma and small cup. Satiny mouthfeel; gently drying nut-toned finish with chicory undertones. In three parts milk, richly bittersweet with chocolate and chicory impulses and a hint of lily.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia, Guatemala and Brazil. The Taiwanese pronunciation of DOHO (tú-hó) means “pure serendipity.” Doho Coffee Roasters has two stores and is dedicated to promoting coffee culture through the high quality of its products. Visit https://www.facebook.com/DOHOCAFE or call +886-49-2318777 for more information.
Bottom Line: A cohesive, harmonious, accessible espresso blend, crisply chocolaty and richly sweet, gently floral.

Review_Description: Savory-leaning, deep-toned. Artichoke blossom, salted caramel, lemon verbena, oak, a hint of musk in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The savory finish centers around notes of artichoke blossom and salted caramel.
Blind Assessment: Savory-leaning, deep-toned. Artichoke blossom, salted caramel, lemon verbena, oak, a hint of musk in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The savory finish centers around notes of artichoke blossom and salted caramel.
Notes: Produced by members of the indigenous Inga community and processed by the honey method, in which the fruit skin is removed but some mucilage is left on the bean during drying. Founded in 1994, Coffee By Design is a specialty coffee roaster in Portland, Maine that also operates three coffee shops in town, as well as one in Freeport. For more information, visit www.coffeebydesign.com.
Bottom Line: Sweet herb and perfumy musk notes complicate this intriguingly savory-toned honey-processed Colombia cup.

Review_Description: Umami-driven, uniquely composed. Green grape, nopales, cashew, elm, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Savory-tart structure with bittersweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Savory-toned finish with notes of nopales and elm.
Blind Assessment: Umami-driven, uniquely composed. Green grape, nopales, cashew, elm, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Savory-tart structure with bittersweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Savory-toned finish with notes of nopales and elm.
Notes: Produced by Gasharu Coffee and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Founded in 1994, Coffee By Design is a specialty coffee roaster in Portland, Maine that also operates three coffee shops in town, as well as one in Freeport. For more information, visit www.coffeebydesign.com.
Bottom Line: An anaerobic-processed coffee characterized by rich bittersweetness and gentle, grapey tartness.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Finca Juan Martin Aced Sidra
Review_Description: Intensely fruit- and floral-toned. Passionfruit, star jasmine, pink grapefruit zest, amber, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with balanced, juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonant, lingering, flavor-saturated finish.
Blind Assessment: Intensely fruit- and floral-toned. Passionfruit, star jasmine, pink grapefruit zest, amber, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with balanced, juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonant, lingering, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by Juan Martin, entirely of the Sidra variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Revel Coffee is a micro-roaster located in Billings, Montana. Its motto: “Quality is paramount – a difference you can revel in.” Visit www.revelcoffee.com or call 406-534-9621 for more information.
Bottom Line: A gorgeous presentation of the rare and admired Sidra variety — natural-processed to amplify fruit and florals — juicy, bright, balanced.

Coffee_Name: Guatemala Natural Santa Felisa Gesha SF-04 95
Review_Description: Balanced, bright, sweetly tart. Dried Concord grape, candied walnut, myrrh, cocoa nib, tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, high-toned acidity; crisp, viscous mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-laden finish.
Blind Assessment: Balanced, bright, sweetly tart. Dried Concord grape, candied walnut, myrrh, cocoa nib, tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, high-toned acidity; crisp, viscous mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: Produced by Agrocomercial Santa Felisa, S.A., entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit www.kakalovecafe.com.tw or email [email protected] for more information.
Bottom Line: A subtly complex, rich-toned anaerobic natural Guatemala cup, elegantly fruit-forward, balanced and juicy.

Review_Description: Delicately fruit-forward, berry-driven. Mulberry jam, cocoa nib, lemon balm, agave syrup, a hint of wine barrel in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-tart structure with citrusy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish consolidates to notes of mulberry and lemon balm.
Blind Assessment: Delicately fruit-forward, berry-driven. Mulberry jam, cocoa nib, lemon balm, agave syrup, a hint of wine barrel in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-tart structure with citrusy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish consolidates to notes of mulberry and lemon balm.
Notes: Produced by the Renancer Project from trees of the Caturra, Castillo and Colombia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) with a double ferment step. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom Line: A quietly fruit-driven washed Colombia with mulberry and lemon throughlines and ballast from cocoa nib, all complicated by a hint of sweet ferment.

Review_Description: Richly sweet, spice-toned. Bergamot, nectarine, almond butter, cocoa nib, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gently bright acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Focused, juicy finish centers around notes of bergamot and cocoa nib.
Coffee Origin: Jimma Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, spice-toned. Bergamot, nectarine, almond butter, cocoa nib, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gently bright acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Focused, juicy finish centers around notes of bergamot and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers entirely of the 74110 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit www.kakalovecafe.com.tw or email [email protected] for more information.
Bottom Line: A classic washed Ethiopia cup with notes of stone fruit, cocoa nib, and distinct florals — harmonious and deep.

Review_Description: Evaluated as espresso. Crisply chocolaty, deeply rich and sweet. Dark chocolate, pomegranate, honeysuckle, pistachio, a hint of sage in aroma and small cup. Plush, syrupy mouthfeel; chocolaty, sweetly herbaceous finish. In cappuccino-scaled milk, notes of dark chocolate are integrated with tart fruit, savory herb, and spice-toned flowers.
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Crisply chocolaty, deeply rich and sweet. Dark chocolate, pomegranate, honeysuckle, pistachio, a hint of sage in aroma and small cup. Plush, syrupy mouthfeel; chocolaty, sweetly herbaceous finish. In cappuccino-scaled milk, notes of dark chocolate are integrated with tart fruit, savory herb, and spice-toned flowers.
Notes: A seasonally rotating blend of origins. This season's blend combines coffees from Colombia, Guatemala and Mexico. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom Line: A harmonious espresso blend that offers a trifecta of chocolate, fruit and flowers — equally delicious in straight shot and cappuccino formats.

Review_Description: Richly floral, deeply aromatic. Narcissus, raspberry, cocoa nib, thyme, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, juicy acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish leads with notes of narcissus and raspberry and undertones of cocoa nib.
Coffee Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly floral, deeply aromatic. Narcissus, raspberry, cocoa nib, thyme, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, juicy acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish leads with notes of narcissus and raspberry and undertones of cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from distinctive landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the traditional washed process (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom Line: A multi-layered, brightly sweet washed Ethiopia cup with deep floral and high-toned berry notes.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, richly chocolaty. Dark chocolate, raspberry coulis, tangerine zest, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; crisp, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, both chocolate and raspberry notes are amplified, supported by tangerine zest and cedar.
Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, richly chocolaty. Dark chocolate, raspberry coulis, tangerine zest, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; crisp, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, both chocolate and raspberry notes are amplified, supported by tangerine zest and cedar.
Notes: Evaluated as espresso. A blend of coffees from Guatemala, Ethiopia and Colombia roasted for espresso applications. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit www.kakalovecafe.com.tw or email [email protected] for more information
Bottom Line: An inviting, richly chocolaty, deeply berry-driven espresso blend with exciting aromatics.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, richly bittersweet. Baking chocolate, pipe tobacco, date, gently scorched mesquite, gardenia in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with notes of pipe tobacco and gardenia.
Blind Assessment: Deep-toned, richly bittersweet. Baking chocolate, pipe tobacco, date, gently scorched mesquite, gardenia in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with notes of pipe tobacco and gardenia.
Notes: A blend of seasonally rotating coffees, currently Guatemala and Mexico. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom Line: A deftly darker-roasted blend that’s enticingly smoky-deep, richly chocolaty and gently floral — especially nice with a splash of whole milk.

Review_Description: Evaluated as espresso. Chocolaty and sweet-toned. Baking chocolate, cashew, molasses, raisin, oak in aroma and cup. Syrupy-smooth mouthfeel; crisp, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, notes of baking chocolate take front and center, with undertones of molasses and cashew.
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Chocolaty and sweet-toned. Baking chocolate, cashew, molasses, raisin, oak in aroma and cup. Syrupy-smooth mouthfeel; crisp, chocolaty finish. In three parts milk, notes of baking chocolate take front and center, with undertones of molasses and cashew.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Colombia and El Salvador designed to be brewed as espresso. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom Line: A very sweet espresso blend, richly nutty and crisply chocolaty, with the chocolate particularly prominent in cappuccino format.

Review_Description: Evaluated as espresso. Richly sweet, earth-toned. Fresh humus, cocoa powder, golden raisin, fir in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; the quiet finish centers around notes of cocoa powder and cedar. In three parts milk, crisply chocolaty, with undertones of aromatic fir.
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Richly sweet, earth-toned. Fresh humus, cocoa powder, golden raisin, fir in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; the quiet finish centers around notes of cocoa powder and cedar. In three parts milk, crisply chocolaty, with undertones of aromatic fir.
Notes: A blend of coffees from Ethiopia, Colombia and Sumatra designed to be brewed as espresso. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom Line: A friendly, accessible espresso that leads with sweet earthy notes, both in the straight shot and in milk.

Review_Description: Balanced, crisply sweet-savory. Tangerine zest, narcissus, marjoram, shitake mushroom, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with quiet acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Floral-toned finish supported by notes of cocoa nib and marjoram.
Blind Assessment: Balanced, crisply sweet-savory. Tangerine zest, narcissus, marjoram, shitake mushroom, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with quiet acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Floral-toned finish supported by notes of cocoa nib and marjoram.
Notes: Produced at Teofahza Farm entirely of the SL34 variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during drying.  HWC Roasters is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taichung, Taiwan. For more information, visit www.hwcroasters.com.
Bottom Line: A multi-layered, crisply sweet-savory honey-processed Alishan cup with cocoa nib and sweet herb notes as throughlines.

Coffee_Name: Galaxy Gesha Quindio Colombia Edwin Noreña
Review_Description: Soaringly high-toned anaerobic, bright, complex, exhilarating. Raspberry, rose, violet, cardamom, passionfruit in aroma and cup. In structure, layered and intriguingly savory-bright. Silky in mouthfeel, nimble and lively on the palate. Flowers carry far into a deep, long finish.
Blind Assessment: Soaringly high-toned anaerobic, bright, complex, exhilarating. Raspberry, rose, violet, cardamom, passionfruit in aroma and cup. In structure, layered and intriguingly savory-bright. Silky in mouthfeel, nimble and lively on the palate. Flowers carry far into a deep, long finish.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Noreña of Finca Campo Hermoso entirely of the Gesha/Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by a particularly elaborate anaerobic processing method. The whole coffee fruit is sealed in drums for CO2 fermentation for 72 hours, after which the skin and pulp are removed from the beans. The skin and pulp are infused with Galaxy hops and recombined with the pulped beans in the carbonic fermentation tanks for another 96 hours before the beans are sun-dried on raised beds. Barrington Coffee is an artisan roaster dedicated to elite coffees, fresh delivery and roasting that foregrounds the coffee and not the roast. Visit www.barringtoncoffee.com or call 800-528-0998 for more information.
Bottom Line: A ringing giant of a coffee with vast, layered aromatics and a structure both bright and deep.

Review_Description: Floral and spice grandeur in a balanced anaerobic. Big, sweet, soaring, perfumy/spicy. Coriander, loquat, marjoram, cocoa, and a range of intense, spicy flowers in aroma and cup. Quite sweet but brightly tangy in structure, with a hint of savory depth. Creamy, lively mouthfeel. The finish is resonant, balanced and lasting.
Coffee Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Floral and spice grandeur in a balanced anaerobic. Big, sweet, soaring, perfumy/spicy. Coriander, loquat, marjoram, cocoa, and a range of intense, spicy flowers in aroma and cup. Quite sweet but brightly tangy in structure, with a hint of savory depth. Creamy, lively mouthfeel. The finish is resonant, balanced and lasting.
Notes: Produced by JN Farms from trees of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by a malolactic fermentation method designed by Miguel Meza, in which whole fruit is inoculated with both yeasts and malolactic bacteria, then fermented in anaerobic conditions for about a week before fruit and pulp are removed and the beans are dried in the fruit flesh or mucilage. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit www.paradiseroasters.com or call 763-433-0626 for more information.
Bottom Line: Sweet spice and flowers star in a high-toned symphonic cup, bright, layered, cocoa-anchored

Coffee_Name: Colombia Finca El Paraiso Rose Tea
Review_Description: Subtly intense anaerobic flower bomb. Sweetly tangy, very brightly floral. Rose, yogurt, blood orange, peach, cashew butter in aroma and cup. Juicy and sweet-tart in structure; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Flowers lead in a balanced finish.
Blind Assessment: Subtly intense anaerobic flower bomb. Sweetly tangy, very brightly floral. Rose, yogurt, blood orange, peach, cashew butter in aroma and cup. Juicy and sweet-tart in structure; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Flowers lead in a balanced finish.
Notes: Produced by Diego Samuel Bermudez Tapia of El Paraiso Farm from trees of the Castillo, Colombia and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic method: Whole fruit is fermented in hermetically sealed tanks for 24 hours before the skins are removed. The fruit flesh or mucilage is left on the bean for another 36-hour sealed-tank fermentation. Finally, the coffee is dried on raised beds with the mucilage still on the bean, as in the honey method. GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit www.gkcoffee.com.tw or email [email protected]
Bottom Line: An original yet balanced anaerobic profile: Bright rose-like flowers are enveloped in a plushly juicy, peach-yogurt-like matrix.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Monteblanco Rodrigo Sanchez Carbonic Maceration
Review_Description: Subtly suave, brightly juicy anaerobic. Rose, strawberry, cocoa, pink lemonade, yogurt in aroma and cup. A juicy floral acidity dominates in structure, deepened by a hint of savory depth. Lightly silky, lively mouthfeel. Strawberry and cocoa give way to flowers in a drying finish.
Blind Assessment: Subtly suave, brightly juicy anaerobic. Rose, strawberry, cocoa, pink lemonade, yogurt in aroma and cup. A juicy floral acidity dominates in structure, deepened by a hint of savory depth. Lightly silky, lively mouthfeel. Strawberry and cocoa give way to flowers in a drying finish.
Notes: Produced by Rodrigo Sanchez of Finca Monteblanco from trees of the Caturra and Bourbon varieties of Arabica, and processed by a carbonic maceration method involving two fermentation phases in closed tanks injected with CO2. The first fermentation involves the whole coffee fruit, after which the skins and pulp are removed and the beans are fermented a second time with their skins and juice, after which they are washed and dried. Klatch Coffee is an award-winning small-batch roasting company in the Los Angeles area whose resident barista and trainer, Heather Perry, won both the 2003 and 2007 United States Barista Championships brewing a Klatch Coffee espresso blend. Visit www.klatchroasting.com or call 877-455-2824 for more information.
Bottom Line: A light-footed and balanced anaerobic cup, floral without perfumy excess, cleanly fruit-toned and silky in texture.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Cauca Granja Paraiso 92 – Pink Bourbon
Review_Description: Exuberant yet coherent anaerobic. Butterscotch, blueberry, cocoa, lilac, candycap mushroom in aroma and cup. Sweet, tart and savory impulses balance in a richly expressive structure. Plush, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit notes consolidate in a long though quiet finish.
Blind Assessment: Exuberant yet coherent anaerobic. Butterscotch, blueberry, cocoa, lilac, candycap mushroom in aroma and cup. Sweet, tart and savory impulses balance in a richly expressive structure. Plush, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit notes consolidate in a long though quiet finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Finca El Paraíso entirely of the rare Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by a complexly detailed version of the double-anaerobic method (sealed-tank fermentation of the whole fruit with the addition of brewer’s yeast, removal of skin and pulp, and a second fermentation of the beans shut in the tank with the removed skin and pulp). Additional processing nuance includes a thermal shock wash (soaking the whole fruit in hot water for 30 seconds, then cold water for 30 seconds) to reduce astringency. Reprise Coffee is a quality-oriented small-batch roaster and café located in Lake Forest, Illinois, north of Chicago. Visit reprisecoffee.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A fruit-forward but balanced, tangy-rich rendition of the anaerobic style.

Review_Description: : Anaerobic intrigue, gracefully balanced. Delicately tangy/tart, sweetly herb- and cocoa-toned. Clove, cocoa, tangerine zest, honey, orchid in aroma and cup. Lightly juicy and sweetly tart in structure; satiny in mouthfeel. The finish is cocoa-centered yet deeply and subtly nuanced.
Blind Assessment: : Anaerobic intrigue, gracefully balanced. Delicately tangy/tart, sweetly herb- and cocoa-toned. Clove, cocoa, tangerine zest, honey, orchid in aroma and cup. Lightly juicy and sweetly tart in structure; satiny in mouthfeel. The finish is cocoa-centered yet deeply and subtly nuanced.
Notes: Produced at Gatta Farm from traditional Ethiopia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Olympia Coffee Roasting is a small-batch wholesale and retail roasting company with a youthful, no-nonsense style and a commitment to high-quality organic coffees. Visit www.olympiacoffee.com or call 360-753-0066 for more information.
Bottom Line: Impressive in its delicate completeness and balance. For those interested in exploring the deeply expressive yet subtler side of the anaerobic style.

Review_Description: Big, round, very sweet anaerobic, intensely floral. Lilac, lavender, strawberry yogurt, roasted macadamia, a hint of musk in aroma and cup. Candy-like sweetness dominates in the structure, balanced by lactic tang and a savory bottom. Buoyantly syrupy mouthfeel. Complex flowers and nut notes dominate in a continuing sweet but savory-edged finish.
Blind Assessment: Big, round, very sweet anaerobic, intensely floral. Lilac, lavender, strawberry yogurt, roasted macadamia, a hint of musk in aroma and cup. Candy-like sweetness dominates in the structure, balanced by lactic tang and a savory bottom. Buoyantly syrupy mouthfeel. Complex flowers and nut notes dominate in a continuing sweet but savory-edged finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Finca El Paraíso entirely of the rare Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by a complexly detailed version of the double-anaerobic method (sealed-tank fermentation of the whole fruit with the addition of brewer’s yeast, removal of skin and pulp, and a second fermentation of the beans shut in the tank with the removed skin and pulp). Additional processing nuance includes a thermal shock wash (soaking the whole fruit in hot water for 30 seconds, then cold water for 30 seconds) to reduce astringency. Prism Coffee Works is a specialty roaster, cafe and barista training center based in Seoul, South Korea. Visit www.instagram.com/prismcoffeeworks for more information.
Bottom Line: A delightful flower bomb of a coffee, with a savory nut-like edge and an inherent balance that saves it from sentimentality.

Review_Description: An almost sugary-sweet, explosively herby and floral anaerobic. Rosemary, pink peppercorn, star jasmine, apricot yogurt, stone fruit in aroma and cup. Very sweet in structure with a tart edge; plush, supple mouthfeel. Yogurt and herb dominate the sweet finish.
Blind Assessment: An almost sugary-sweet, explosively herby and floral anaerobic. Rosemary, pink peppercorn, star jasmine, apricot yogurt, stone fruit in aroma and cup. Very sweet in structure with a tart edge; plush, supple mouthfeel. Yogurt and herb dominate the sweet finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilder Lazo of Finca Bella Alejandria entirely of the Gesha/Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by a version of the honey or semi-washed anaerobic method: after the removal of the fruit skin and pulp, but with the flesh or mucilage still on the bean, the coffee is fermented in hermetically sealed tanks for 200 hours. After fermentation, the coffee is sun-dried for 18 days mixed with mandarin orange peels before being rested for 25 days, then milled. Founded in Savannah Georgia, PERC Coffee Roasters has a total of three cafes in Savannah and Atlanta, as well as a coffee education and training center. Visit www.perccoffee.com for more information.
Bottom Line: Original and complex in its herb and flowers; almost disconcertingly sweet, with just an edge of yogurty tang.

Review_Description: Intense, eccentric anaerobic candy-bomb. Very sweet, intensely fruity and spicy. Bubblegum, musk, raspberry, pistachio, ginger in aroma and cup. Profoundly sweet in structure with a touch of delicately tart acidity. Velvety, lively mouthfeel. In the finish candyish notes fade and musky flowers come forward.
Blind Assessment: Intense, eccentric anaerobic candy-bomb. Very sweet, intensely fruity and spicy. Bubblegum, musk, raspberry, pistachio, ginger in aroma and cup. Profoundly sweet in structure with a touch of delicately tart acidity. Velvety, lively mouthfeel. In the finish candyish notes fade and musky flowers come forward.
Notes: Produced by Sebastián Ramirez of Finca El Placer entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by a proprietary anaerobic method, in which 95% ripe and 5% semi-ripe cherries undergo two phases of fermentation. First, the coffee is fermented in the whole cherry in sealed 200-liter tanks for 120 hours at 18 degrees Celsius, with microorganisms present. Then, skins and pulp are removed, leaving some of the fruit flesh on the beans, which are fermented anaerobically for 72 hours with the addition of CO2. The coffee is then slow-dried for 15 days. Chromatic Coffee prides itself in doing everything in-house and meticulously, from printing its attractive bags to modifying equipment to sourcing and roasting its fine coffees. Visit www.chromaticcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A candy-like sweetness is complicated by a lavish, unpredictable display of eccentric aromatic notes, from bubblegum to ginger to musk.

Review_Description: Exceptionally sweet, very lactic and yogurty, strikingly original in aromatics. Candied violet, clove, rose yogurt, lavender, frankincense in aroma and cup. Sweet and complexly layered in structure. Syrupy mouthfeel. Richly sweet in the finish.
Blind Assessment: Exceptionally sweet, very lactic and yogurty, strikingly original in aromatics. Candied violet, clove, rose yogurt, lavender, frankincense in aroma and cup. Sweet and complexly layered in structure. Syrupy mouthfeel. Richly sweet in the finish.
Notes: Produced by Jairo Arcila of Finca Santa Monica, and processed by a controversial variation of the anaerobic method: fermented in the whole fruit in sealed tanks for 72 hours with the addition of peach pulp and wine yeasts, then pulped and dried on raised beds with peach pieces scattered among the beans. Royal Flamingo is a Columbus, Ohio-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit www.royalflamingocoffee.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A particularly sweet anaerobic, with a distinct lactic tang and a surprising, unusual range of aromatics.

Review_Description: Elegantly fruit-toned, tropical. Lychee, passionfruit, bergamot, star jasmine, lemon thyme in aroma and cup. Gently bright, sweet structure with high-toned acidity; very rich, buoyantly creamy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, integrated finish.
Blind Assessment: Elegantly fruit-toned, tropical. Lychee, passionfruit, bergamot, star jasmine, lemon thyme in aroma and cup. Gently bright, sweet structure with high-toned acidity; very rich, buoyantly creamy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, integrated finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez entirely of the Papayo variety of Arabica. Processed by the kōji method, in which the coffee fruit is first sterilized and then fermented in a bio-reactor and inoculated with a selection of Japanese kōji (Aspergillus oryzae). This mold species breaks down starch into simple sugars and is commonly used in the production of soy sauce, miso, sake and shōchū. After whole-fruit fermentation, the coffee is pulped and subjected to a second fermentation phase. A bean-sealing process follows, carried out through impacts of hot and cold water, before the beans are dried by machine for 46 hours at 38C (100F). Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit www.paradiseroasters.com or call 763-433-0626 for more information.
Bottom Line: A uniquely composed cup from a rare variety of Arabica (Papayo), meticulously processed using complex methods by Wilton Benitez, widely recognized for his innovative processing experiments.

Review_Description: Delicately fruit-toned, richly sweet-tart. Raspberry, magnolia, baking chocolate, honey, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; viscous, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The quiet finish centers around raspberry and crisp chocolate notes.
Blind Assessment: Delicately fruit-toned, richly sweet-tart. Raspberry, magnolia, baking chocolate, honey, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; viscous, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The quiet finish centers around raspberry and crisp chocolate notes.
Notes: Produced at Aquíares Estate entirely of the Centroamericano variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). David's Nose is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taipei, Taiwan whose founder studied agronomy and has a deep interest in crop quality. For more information, visit www.dnose.com.tw.
Bottom Line: An accessibly complex natural-processed Costa Rica that leads with distinct berry notes with undertones of crisp chocolate and sweet herbs.

Review_Description: Cleanly fruit-toned, crisply chocolaty. Date, pomegranate, cocoa nib, maple syrup, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with high-toned, balanced acidity; viscous, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-laden finish.
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Cleanly fruit-toned, crisply chocolaty. Date, pomegranate, cocoa nib, maple syrup, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with high-toned, balanced acidity; viscous, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: Produced by Dinkalem Ademe entirely of the Wush Wush variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Established in 2010, Red Rooster is an organic-certified micro-roaster focusing on socially conscious, high-quality coffee. Visit redroostercoffee.com or call 540-745-7338 for more information.
Bottom Line: A rare single-farmer Ethiopia and a rare variety of Arabica, this natural-processed Wush Wush is super-clean, deep-toned, and richly sweet.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet-savory, gently lactic. Strawberry yogurt, lemon verbena, baking chocolate, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with tangy acidity; soft, velvety mouthfeel. Crisp, fruit- and cocoa-toned finish.
Coffee Origin: Chiriqui, Boquete growing region, western Panama
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet-savory, gently lactic. Strawberry yogurt, lemon verbena, baking chocolate, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with tangy acidity; soft, velvety mouthfeel. Crisp, fruit- and cocoa-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Rosas of Finca Lorayne entirely of the Catuaí variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which coffee in the whole fruit is fermented in an oxygen-free environment before being dried, also in the whole fruit. Ragamuffin Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster based in Newbury Park, California. Visit www.ragamuffinroasters.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A pretty Panama Catuaí that expresses the classic tanginess of the anaerobic natural profile with delicacy and balance.

Review_Description: Wildly tropical, fruity and deep. Passion fruit, mango, tamarind, rice candy, hop flowers in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; plushly syrupy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, fruity finish.
Blind Assessment: Wildly tropical, fruity and deep. Passion fruit, mango, tamarind, rice candy, hop flowers in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; plushly syrupy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, fruity finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica and processed by a proprietary anaerobic fermentation method in which ​​the coffee fruit is first sterilized, then fermented anaerobically in the whole fruit with added microorganisms for 36 hours. After this fermentation in the whole fruit, the coffee is subjected to thermal shock (first a high temperature to swell the beans and allow the unique flavors and aromas from the initial anaerobic yeast fermentation to penetrate the seeds, then a cold temperature to constrict the beans and lock in those flavors and aromas). Finally, the whole cherries are carefully dried by machine until the beans reach 10.5% internal humidity. Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. Visit modcup.com for more information.
Bottom Line: An unabashed fruit bomb of a coffee: produced entirely from the rare Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed anaerobically, netting an intense, flavor-saturated, richly aromatic profile with ballast from bittersweet floral notes.

Coffee_Name: Kenya Kiambu Mandela Estate AA Washed Process
Review_Description: Complex, nuanced, multi-layered. Black currant, freesia, amber, toffee, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, high-toned acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with black currant and toffee notes in the short, rounding to amber and cedar in the long.
Blind Assessment: Complex, nuanced, multi-layered. Black currant, freesia, amber, toffee, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, high-toned acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with black currant and toffee notes in the short, rounding to amber and cedar in the long.
Notes: Produced by the Kariruki family from trees of the classic Kenya SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom Line: A distinctive Kenya cup laden with classic black currant notes and undertones of spicy florals — especially vibrant acidity.

Coffee_Name: Costa Rica Volcán Azul Geisha Yeast-Washed
Review_Description: Richly sweet-tart, fruit-toned. Concord grape, dark chocolate, star anise, sandalwood, pineapple saltwater taffy in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with tart-savory acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned Concord grape takes center stage in the finish, supported by star anise and dark chocolate.
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-tart, fruit-toned. Concord grape, dark chocolate, star anise, sandalwood, pineapple saltwater taffy in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with tart-savory acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned Concord grape takes center stage in the finish, supported by star anise and dark chocolate.
Notes: Produced by Alejo Castro of Volcán Azul entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic washed method, in which the de-pulped coffee fruit is fermented with limited oxygen, in this case with the addition of wine yeasts, before washing and drying. Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit shopee.tw/zengkaochen for more information.
Bottom Line: An aromatically exciting washed anaerobic Costa Rica Geisha saturated with high-toned fruit, deep chocolate, and rich spice tones.

Review_Description: Gently sweet-tart, floral-toned. Pomegranate, wisteria, pistachio, lime zest, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet-tart structure with delicately bright acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The tart-leaning finish leads with notes of pomegranate and lime zest, with undertones of oak and pistachio.
Blind Assessment: Gently sweet-tart, floral-toned. Pomegranate, wisteria, pistachio, lime zest, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet-tart structure with delicately bright acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The tart-leaning finish leads with notes of pomegranate and lime zest, with undertones of oak and pistachio.
Notes: Produced by members of the Adame Garbota Cooperative and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Caoban Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Taipei. Visit www.facebook.com/CAOBANCOFFEE for more information.
Bottom Line: A juicy, bright natural-processed Ethiopia cup — invitingly tart, balanced by sweet floral and aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Sweetly fruit-forward, richly aromatic. Lychee, tangerine zest, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with bright acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of lychee and tangerine zest with cocoa undertones.
Blind Assessment: Sweetly fruit-forward, richly aromatic. Lychee, tangerine zest, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with bright acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of lychee and tangerine zest with cocoa undertones.
Notes: Yirgacheffe is a coffee region in southern Ethiopia that produces distinctive coffees from traditional selections of landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying).  Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom Line: A complex, balanced washed Ethiopia cup with cocoa-toned tropical fruit and sweet herb suggestions.

Coffee_Name: Costa Rica Tarrazu Caturra Anaerobic Natural Espresso
Review_Description: Evaluated as espresso. Deeply floral, spice-toned. Baking spices, narcissus, dark chocolate, cedar, a hint of wine barrel in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; richly wood-framed, fruit-forward finish. In three parts milk, baking spices predominate, with undertones of sweetly spicy florals.
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Deeply floral, spice-toned. Baking spices, narcissus, dark chocolate, cedar, a hint of wine barrel in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel; richly wood-framed, fruit-forward finish. In three parts milk, baking spices predominate, with undertones of sweetly spicy florals.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole coffee fruit is fermented with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit shopee.tw/zengkaochen for more information.
Bottom Line: A uniquely composed anaerobic natural Costa Rica roasted for espresso applications, with heady floral and warm spice notes in both the straight shot and in cappuccino-scaled milk.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Banko Gotiti  G1 Natural
Review_Description: Balanced, crisply fruit-toned. Black cherry, pink grapefruit zest, almond, agave syrup, lilac in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Delicately fruit-toned finish with undertones of almond.
Coffee Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Balanced, crisply fruit-toned. Black cherry, pink grapefruit zest, almond, agave syrup, lilac in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Delicately fruit-toned finish with undertones of almond.
Notes: Produced by smallholding-farmer members of Banko Gotiti Cooperative in the district of Gedeb, Ethiopia, from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Caoban Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Taipei. Visit www.facebook.com/CAOBANCOFFEE for more information.
Bottom Line: A delicate, balanced natural-processed Ethiopia cup, fruit-forward and nutty with floral undertones.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Guji Bule Hora Blue Nile Natural
Review_Description: Balanced, delicate, fruit-toned. Lily, baking chocolate, dried blueberry, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with brisk acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish with cedar undertones.
Coffee Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Balanced, delicate, fruit-toned. Lily, baking chocolate, dried blueberry, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with brisk acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish with cedar undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom Line: A natural-processed Ethiopia characterized by pleasing aromatic wood notes with support from ripe berry and crisp chocolate.

Review_Description: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly nut-toned. Hazelnut, cocoa nib, red apple, caramel, fresh-cut fir in aroma and small cup. Crisply velvety mouthfeel; gently drying, nut-toned finish. Lively and complex in three parts milk, with nut and caramel tones commingling, supported by notes of apple and cocoa nib.
Blind Assessment: Evaluated as espresso. Sweetly nut-toned. Hazelnut, cocoa nib, red apple, caramel, fresh-cut fir in aroma and small cup. Crisply velvety mouthfeel; gently drying, nut-toned finish. Lively and complex in three parts milk, with nut and caramel tones commingling, supported by notes of apple and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced in Guatemala and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Coffee Dusk is a café and nano-roaster based in Daejeon, South Korea. Visit https://www.instagram.com/COFFEEDUSK/ for more information.
Bottom Line: A washed Guatemala roasted for espresso applications; especially lively and complex in cappuccino-scaled milk.

Review_Description: Crisply chocolaty, roast-rounded. Baking chocolate, gently scorched fir, salted caramel, date, orange zest in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with gentle, round acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of salted caramel.
Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, roast-rounded. Baking chocolate, gently scorched fir, salted caramel, date, orange zest in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with gentle, round acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of salted caramel.
Notes: A blend comprised of two green coffees, a washed-process Rwanda and a natural-processed Ethiopia. Philipsburg Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster based in Montana’s Flint Creek Valley that focuses on four or five seasonally rotating coffees at a time. Visit philipsburgcoffeeroasters.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A medium-dark roasted Rwanda/Ethiopia blend driven by notes of date and crisp chocolate with a hint of roastiness.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet-tart, richly nut-toned. Black cherry, cocoa nib, hazelnut, lime zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with gently bright, balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The flavor-saturated finish centers around sweet nut and chocolate tones.
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart, richly nut-toned. Black cherry, cocoa nib, hazelnut, lime zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with gently bright, balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The flavor-saturated finish centers around sweet nut and chocolate tones.
Notes: Produced by ELLA —Women Producers of Guatemala — from trees of the Catuai, Bourbon and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.
Bottom Line: A bright, balanced, women-farmed Guatemala cup driven by dark stone fruit, crisp chocolate, and deeply sweet hazelnut notes.

Review_Description: Richly floral, subtly complex. Star jasmine, cocoa nib, apricot, almond butter, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with floral acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The resonant finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and almond butter.
Coffee Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Richly floral, subtly complex. Star jasmine, cocoa nib, apricot, almond butter, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with floral acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The resonant finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and almond butter.
Notes: Produced by smallholding-farmer members Banko Gotiti Cooperative located in the village of Banko Gotiti in the southern district of Gedeb, Ethiopia, from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.
Bottom Line: A classic Ethiopia cup — juicy, brightly sweet, freshly floral, cocoa-toned — balanced and inviting.

Review_Description: Sweetly citrusy, floral-toned. Violet, pink grapefruit, baking chocolate, fresh-cut fir, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of pink grapefruit and fresh-cut fir.
Coffee Origin: Hambela Wamena, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Sweetly citrusy, floral-toned. Violet, pink grapefruit, baking chocolate, fresh-cut fir, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of pink grapefruit and fresh-cut fir.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers surrounding METAD's Hambela Estate from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.
Bottom Line: A friendly washed-process Ethiopia cup with gently sweet notes of citrus and delicate flowers throughout, supported by rich aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet-tart. Pomegranate, freesia, cashew butter, oak, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with brisk acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish that leads with notes of cashew butter and oak.
Blind Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart. Pomegranate, freesia, cashew butter, oak, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with brisk acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish that leads with notes of cashew butter and oak.
Notes: Produced by Don Arcenio Castillo from trees of the Caturra and Bourbon varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.
Bottom Line: A brightly sweet, tart Guatemala profile with ballast from rich nut and aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Crisp, sweetly nut-toned. Hazelnut, caramel, roasted pear, balsam, lemon zest in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The gently drying finish leads with notes of hazelnut and caramel, with undertones of balsam.
Blind Assessment: Crisp, sweetly nut-toned. Hazelnut, caramel, roasted pear, balsam, lemon zest in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The gently drying finish leads with notes of hazelnut and caramel, with undertones of balsam.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of Cooperativa El Porvenir from trees of the Bourbon, Caturra and Yellow Catuaí varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.
Bottom Line: A crisply nutty, richly wood-framed Guatemala natural cup.

Review_Description: Richly sweet-savory, spice-toned. Dried fig, pistachio, allspice, narcissus, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Vibrantly sweet-savory structure with juicy acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. The resonant finish consolidates to notes of salted caramel and allspice.
Coffee Origin: Mathira West District, Nyeri growing region, Kenya
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet-savory, spice-toned. Dried fig, pistachio, allspice, narcissus, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Vibrantly sweet-savory structure with juicy acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. The resonant finish consolidates to notes of salted caramel and allspice.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Gikanda Farmers Cooperative Society from trees of the SL28, SL34 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method at the Gichathaini Factory. Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features selections from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Visit www.templecoffee.com or call 916-454-1282 for more information.
Bottom Line: A complex, multi-layered Kenya cup with a trifecta of sweet, spice-toned and umami impulses.

Coffee_Name: Guatemala Retiro del Quisaya Natural Process
Review_Description: Berry-driven, brightly sweet-tart. Berry melange, cocoa nib, amber, cedar, a hint of sassafras in aroma and cup. Complex, bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The long, resonant finish centers around cocoa nib and raspberry notes.
Coffee Origin: San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango Department, Guatemala
Blind Assessment: Berry-driven, brightly sweet-tart. Berry melange, cocoa nib, amber, cedar, a hint of sassafras in aroma and cup. Complex, bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The long, resonant finish centers around cocoa nib and raspberry notes.
Notes: Produced by Juan Luis Barrios Ortega of Finca Retiro del Quisaya from trees of the Bourbon, Typica and Pache varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Located in southwestern Colorado, Durango Coffee lays claim to a rich coffee history that dates to 1986. Its motto is “Tough Town, Great Coffee.” Visit www.durangocoffee.com or call 800-748-2275 for more information.
Bottom Line: A fruit-forward natural-processed Guatemala cup complicated by resiny amber-like notes and a rich cocoa throughline.

Review_Description: Elegantly fruit-toned, lactic-leaning. Mulberry, pineapple yogurt, cocoa nib, hop flowers, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with bright, winy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp finish with notes of pineapple yogurt and sandalwood.
Blind Assessment: Elegantly fruit-toned, lactic-leaning. Mulberry, pineapple yogurt, cocoa nib, hop flowers, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with bright, winy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp finish with notes of pineapple yogurt and sandalwood.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from local heirloom varieties long grown in the region, and processed by the Yonis family at the Gara Agena Washing Station by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole coffee fruit is fermented with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. RamsHead Coffee Roasters is a family-owned company founded by Bozeman, Montana natives Caleb and Laura Walker that specializes in direct trade microlot coffees. For more information, visit www.ramsheadcoffee.com.
Bottom Line: An unabashedly fruit-forward anaerobic natural Ethiopia with the tangy, yogurt-like aromatics and flavor that often result from anaerobic fermentation; dark berry fruit, cocoa nib and bittersweet florals round out the profile.

Review_Description: Deeply sweet, richly savory. Dark chocolate, apricot, lilac, almond, cedar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The sweet finish consolidates to notes of dark chocolate and almond butter.
Blind Assessment: Deeply sweet, richly savory. Dark chocolate, apricot, lilac, almond, cedar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The sweet finish consolidates to notes of dark chocolate and almond butter.
Notes: Produced by Geiner Montano of Finca La Esperanza from trees of the Colombia and Castillo varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (skin and fruit flesh are removed before drying). Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features coffee from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Visit www.templecoffee.com or call 916-454-1282 for more information.
Bottom Line: A classic washed Colombia cup with deep chocolate notes and especially vibrant, high-toned acidity.

Coffee_Name: Guatemala Retiro del Quisaya Washed Process
Review_Description: Richly sweet, nut- and spice-toned. Macadamia nut, caramel, nutmeg, baking chocolate, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with balanced, bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Quietly confident, caramelly and nutty finish.
Coffee Origin: San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango Department, Guatemala
Blind Assessment: Richly sweet, nut- and spice-toned. Macadamia nut, caramel, nutmeg, baking chocolate, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with balanced, bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Quietly confident, caramelly and nutty finish.
Notes: Produced by Juan Luis Barrios Ortega of Finca Retiro del Quisaya from trees of the Bourbon, Typica and Pache varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (skin and fruit pulp removed before washing). Located in southwestern Colorado, Durango Coffee lays claim to a rich coffee history that dates to 1986. Its motto is “Tough Town, Great Coffee.” Visit www.durangocoffee.com or call 800-748-2275 for more information.
Bottom Line: A balanced washed Guatemala cup with deeply sweet nut and rich caramel tones throughout

Review_Description: Brightly sweet-tart. Lime zest, baking chocolate, agave syrup, freesia, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and marjoram.
Blind Assessment: Brightly sweet-tart. Lime zest, baking chocolate, agave syrup, freesia, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and marjoram.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers in the Kindeng and Arufa municipalities and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Rusty Dog Coffee is a Madison, Wisconsin-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit www.rustydogcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom Line: An invitingly tart-leaning natural-processed Papua New Guinea with suggestions of bright citrus and crisp chocolate throughout.

Review_Description: Bright, juicy-sweet. Dark chocolate, goji berry, fine musk, almond butter, cedar in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; resonant finish consolidates to notes of goji berry and almond. In three parts milk, dark chocolate notes are amplified, while dried berry notes provide sweet-tart ballast.
Coffee Origin: Kabiufa, Eastern Highlands, Papua New Guinea
Blind Assessment: Bright, juicy-sweet. Dark chocolate, goji berry, fine musk, almond butter, cedar in aroma and small cup. Creamy-smooth mouthfeel; resonant finish consolidates to notes of goji berry and almond. In three parts milk, dark chocolate notes are amplified, while dried berry notes provide sweet-tart ballast.
Notes: Evaluated as espresso. Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Arusha, Bourbon and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit pulp and skin removed before drying). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit www.jbccoffeeroasters.com or call 608-256-5282 for more information
Bottom Line: A harmonious, complex PNG espresso that offers a medley of dried fruit, rich aromatic wood and deep chocolate notes.

Review_Description: Cocoa-toned, delicately sweet-tart. Cocoa nib, almond nougat, Cara Cara orange, magnolia, lemon thyme in aroma and small cup. Gently bright structure with juicy-sweet acidity; full, vibrant mouthfeel. Cocoa- and citrus-toned finish.
Coffee Origin: Ka‘u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Blind Assessment: Cocoa-toned, delicately sweet-tart. Cocoa nib, almond nougat, Cara Cara orange, magnolia, lemon thyme in aroma and small cup. Gently bright structure with juicy-sweet acidity; full, vibrant mouthfeel. Cocoa- and citrus-toned finish.
Notes: Produced at Miranda Farms entirely of the Red Catuai variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit www.paradiseroasters.com or call 763-433-0626 for more information.
Bottom Line: A subtly complex, quietly confident Ka‘ū cup with equal impulses toward cocoa and sweet citrus.

Coffee_Name: El Venado Costa Rica Yellow Honey SL28
Review_Description: Delicately high-toned, balanced. Pink grapefruit, cocoa nib, narcissus, lychee, a hint of green peppercorn in aroma and small cup. Richly viscous mouthfeel; cocoa-toned finish with a hint of pink grapefruit. In cappuccino-scaled milk, floral and cocoa notes take center stage, while sweet citrus recedes.
Coffee Origin: West Valley growing region, Costa Rica
Blind Assessment: Delicately high-toned, balanced. Pink grapefruit, cocoa nib, narcissus, lychee, a hint of green peppercorn in aroma and small cup. Richly viscous mouthfeel; cocoa-toned finish with a hint of pink grapefruit. In cappuccino-scaled milk, floral and cocoa notes take center stage, while sweet citrus recedes.
Notes: Evaluated as espresso. Produced at Finca El Venado and processed at Cerro San Luis Micromill entirely of the SL28 variety of Arabica, and processed by the yellow honey method. With all honey processing methods, some sweet pulp or fruit flesh (“honey”) is allowed to adhere to the beans during drying. In the yellow honey variation, a thin layer of pulp is allowed to dry on the beans, more than with white honey, but less than is the case with red or black honey. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit www.jbccoffeeroasters.com or call 608-256-5282 for more information
Bottom Line: A pretty Costa Rica yellow honey espresso with an especially inviting mouthfeel; citrusy and floral in the straight shot.

Review_Description: Baking chocolate, mulberry, squash blossom, hazelnut, fresh-cut oak in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and roasted squash. In cappuccino format, savory notes predominate, with undertones of mulberry and baking chocolate.
Coffee Origin: Kabare, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Blind Assessment: Baking chocolate, mulberry, squash blossom, hazelnut, fresh-cut oak in aroma and small cup. Crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and roasted squash. In cappuccino format, savory notes predominate, with undertones of mulberry and baking chocolate.
Notes: Evaluated as espresso. Produced by smallholding farmers entirely of the Blue Mountain variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Certified Fair Trade and USDA Organic. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit www.jbccoffeeroasters.com or call 608-256-5282 for more information.
Bottom Line: An enticingly savory-leaning espresso with a throughline of sweet squash (and squash blossom) notes and undertones of crisp chocolate and sweet-tart berries.

Review_Description: Complex, multi-layered. Cocoa nib, Meyer lemon marmalade, magnolia, hazelnut, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with high-toned acidity; very satiny, smooth mouthfeel. Crisp finish that leads with notes of Meyer lemon and cocoa nib.
Coffee Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Complex, multi-layered. Cocoa nib, Meyer lemon marmalade, magnolia, hazelnut, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with high-toned acidity; very satiny, smooth mouthfeel. Crisp finish that leads with notes of Meyer lemon and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by the Hassen family at their estate farm in the Guji Zone of southern Ethiopia from distinctive landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region. This is a dry-processed or “natural” version, meaning the beans were dried inside the fruit rather than after the fruit has been removed, as is the case with wet-processed or “washed” coffees. Certified USDA organic. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom Line: A heady, deep-toned cup with citrus, floral and cocoa impulses.

Review_Description: Rich-toned, deeply sweet. Salted caramel, pomegranate, almond butter, narcissus, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory structure with citrusy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp, focused finish centered around notes of salted caramel and almond.
Blind Assessment: Rich-toned, deeply sweet. Salted caramel, pomegranate, almond butter, narcissus, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory structure with citrusy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp, focused finish centered around notes of salted caramel and almond.
Notes: Produced by Jancarlo and Sofia Handtke of Mapache Estate entirely of the big-beaned Pacamara variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom Line: An inviting El Salvador Pacamara cup with tart fruit and caramel notes throughout, and an especially viscous mouthfeel.

Coffee_Name: Panama Finca Las Nubes Geisha Microlot
Review_Description: Balanced, delicately sweet-tart. Dark chocolate, magnolia, goji berry, almond brittle, blood orange in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with vibrant acidity; crisp, silky-smooth mouthfeel. The pleasing finish centers around notes of dark chocolate and goji berry.
Blind Assessment: Balanced, delicately sweet-tart. Dark chocolate, magnolia, goji berry, almond brittle, blood orange in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with vibrant acidity; crisp, silky-smooth mouthfeel. The pleasing finish centers around notes of dark chocolate and goji berry.
Notes: Produced by Austin Gomez of Finca Las Nubes entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Vermont Artisan Coffee & Tea provides craft-roasted coffees and quality teas to retail establishments, food service markets, and retail customers throughout New England and beyond. For more information, visit www.vtartisan.com.
Bottom Line: Sweet dried fruit notes and rich dark chocolate, supported by deep florals, drive this natural Panama Geisha cup, an exceptional value for its variety and origin.

Review_Description: Confident, juicy-bright. Black currant, cocoa nib, freesia, orange zest, fresh-cut cedar in aroma and cup. High-toned structure with phosphoric acidity; medium-weight, viscous mouthfeell. The lively finish leads with notes of black currant and hints of spice-toned florals.
Blind Assessment: Confident, juicy-bright. Black currant, cocoa nib, freesia, orange zest, fresh-cut cedar in aroma and cup. High-toned structure with phosphoric acidity; medium-weight, viscous mouthfeell. The lively finish leads with notes of black currant and hints of spice-toned florals.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Located in southwestern Colorado, Durango Coffee lays claim to a rich coffee history that dates to 1986. Its motto is “Tough Town, Great Coffee.” Visit www.durangocoffee.com or call 800-748-2275 for more information.
Bottom Line: A classic Kenya cup with vibrant acidity and particularly vivid expressions of the black currant and cocoa notes often associated with this origin.

Review_Description: Sweetly-fruit-forward. Just-picked blueberry, honeycomb, cashew butter, marjoram, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with pert acidity; pillowy, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish is centered around notes of honey and cashew.
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Sweetly-fruit-forward. Just-picked blueberry, honeycomb, cashew butter, marjoram, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with pert acidity; pillowy, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish is centered around notes of honey and cashew.
Notes: Produced in the distinguished Guji growing region, nestled next to Ethiopia's better-known Yirgacheffe and Sidamo regions, largely from distinctive indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). The Nomadic Bean is a one-woman show, owned and operated by roaster Margo Askins and based in Jackson Hole, Wyoming. Visit www.nomadicbean.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A natural-processed Ethiopia with an especially plush, inviting mouthfeel and distinct blueberry notes with crisp chocolate undertones.

Review_Description: Richly and brightly sweet-savory. Raspberry, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, cedar, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Complex, bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of cocoa nib and pink grapefruit zest.
Blind Assessment: Richly and brightly sweet-savory. Raspberry, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, cedar, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Complex, bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of cocoa nib and pink grapefruit zest.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from trees of the SL28 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Color Coffee, which started as a home-roasting project, was formally founded in 2016 in Eagle, Colorado. Visit www.colorroasters.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A juicy, bright Kenya, multi-layered and rich-toned, with cocoa nib and berries as throughlines.

Review_Description: Balanced, deeply sweet. Black currant, ginger blossom, orange zest, cedar, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with malic (green apple-like) acidity; delicately satiny mouthfeel. The finish leads with notes of cocoa nib and cedar.
Blind Assessment: Balanced, deeply sweet. Black currant, ginger blossom, orange zest, cedar, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with malic (green apple-like) acidity; delicately satiny mouthfeel. The finish leads with notes of cocoa nib and cedar.
Notes: Produced by the Muigai Family from trees of the SL28, SL34, K7 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Certified USDA Organic. Based in southern Oregon, Noble Coffee is a wholesale and retail roasting company focused on quality, social responsibility and environmental consciousness. Visit www.noblecoffeeroasting.com or call 541-488-3288 for more information.
Bottom Line: An easygoing Kenya cup with classic notes of black currant supported by crisp cocoa and rich aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Sweetly-tart, fruit-toned. Dried raspberry, baking chocolate, clove, lime zest, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Spice-toned finish with undercurrents of berries and crisp chocolate.
Blind Assessment: Sweetly-tart, fruit-toned. Dried raspberry, baking chocolate, clove, lime zest, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Spice-toned finish with undercurrents of berries and crisp chocolate.
Notes: A seasonally rotating blend of two organic-certified Ethiopia coffees, one washed and one natural-processed. Big Creek Coffee Roasters is a small, quality-oriented batch roaster located in Montana’s Bitterroot Valley. Visit www.bigcreekcoffeeroasters.com for more information.
Bottom Line: This blend of two organic Ethiopia coffees offers a lively and original range of aroma and flavor, from baking spices to dried berries.

Review_Description: Sweet-toned, pleasingly floral. Baking chocolate, honeysuckle, hazelnut, fresh-cut fir, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; full, velvety mouthfeel. Crisp, sweet, wood-framed finish with undertones of baking chocolate and hazelnut.
Blind Assessment: Sweet-toned, pleasingly floral. Baking chocolate, honeysuckle, hazelnut, fresh-cut fir, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; full, velvety mouthfeel. Crisp, sweet, wood-framed finish with undertones of baking chocolate and hazelnut.
Notes: This sample consists entirely of peaberries, a kind of bean that results when the coffee fruit develops a single, oval bean rather than the usual pair of flat-sided beans. Perhaps arbitrarily, Tanzania is particularly associated with its peaberry grades. Pink Elephant Coffee, with a cafe in Park City, Utah and a roastery in nearby Heber City, crafts coffees for Western adventurers, and commits a portion of sales proceeds to conservation-minded nonprofits. Visit www.pinkelephantcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom Line: Delicately crisp chocolate and sweet floral notes animate this inviting, subtly complex Tanzania.

Review_Description: Delicately sweet-tart. Green grape, cocoa powder, bay leaf, fresh-cut fir, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The gently drying finish leads with notes of cocoa powder and brown sugar, with hints of sweet herbs in the long.
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Delicately sweet-tart. Green grape, cocoa powder, bay leaf, fresh-cut fir, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The gently drying finish leads with notes of cocoa powder and brown sugar, with hints of sweet herbs in the long.
Notes: Produced in the distinguished Guji growing region, nestled next to Ethiopia's better-known Yirgacheffe and Sidamo regions, largely from distinctive indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Breck Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster in Breckenridge, Colorado committed to high quality coffee and social and environmental responsibility. Visit www.breckenridgecoffeeroasters.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A friendly, engaging Ethiopia natural cup whose tart fruit impulses are balanced by crisp cocoa and sweet herb.

Review_Description: Crisply chocolaty, rich-toned. Baking chocolate, pomegranate, gingerbread, Meyer lemon zest, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Savory-sweet structure with bright, lively acidity; crisp yet velvety mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of pomegranate and pink peppercorn.
Blind Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, rich-toned. Baking chocolate, pomegranate, gingerbread, Meyer lemon zest, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Savory-sweet structure with bright, lively acidity; crisp yet velvety mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of pomegranate and pink peppercorn.
Notes: Produced by the Menendez Family of Menendez Estates entirely of the Pacamara variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed from the beans before drying). Backporch Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster based in Bend, Oregon. Visit www.backporchcoffeeroasters.com for more information.
Bottom Line: A bold Pacamara from El Salvador that will appeal to those who like rich, chocolaty coffees with tart fruit and spice undertones.

Review_Description: Gently fruit-toned, richly wood-framed. Pie cherry, balsa wood, maple syrup, lemon balm, grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with gentle, round acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. Wood-framed finish with tart cherry and grapefruit suggestions.
Coffee Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind Assessment: Gently fruit-toned, richly wood-framed. Pie cherry, balsa wood, maple syrup, lemon balm, grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with gentle, round acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. Wood-framed finish with tart cherry and grapefruit suggestions.
Notes: Dur Feres, which means "wild horse" in Amharic, is a blend of green coffees from several southern Ethiopian wet mills or washing stations, including Bombe, Qonqona, Shantawene, and Damo, all processed by the natural method (coffee is dried in the whole fruit). Drink Coffee Do Stuff operates a roastery in Truckee, California and a coffee shop in nearby Incline Village, Nevada. Visit www.drinkcoffeedostuff.com for more information.
Bottom Line: An invigoratingly tart-leaning natural Ethiopia with integrated and harmonious aromatic wood suggestions throughout.

Review_Description: High-toned, chocolaty and richly aromatic. Malted chocolate, black cherry, cashew butter, pink grapefruit, toffee in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with lively but restrained acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. The integrated finish carries over all the aroma and flavor notes from the cup.
Blind Assessment: High-toned, chocolaty and richly aromatic. Malted chocolate, black cherry, cashew butter, pink grapefruit, toffee in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with lively but restrained acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. The integrated finish carries over all the aroma and flavor notes from the cup.
Notes: Produced by Juan Villatoro of Finca El Milagro, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Roasted at PT’s Coffee, where the motto is “without the love, it’s just coffee.” Visit www.ptscoffee.com or call 888-678-JAVA for more information.
Bottom Line: An elegantly sweet, rich-toned Guatemala Bourbon — balanced, bright, juicy and deep.

Review_Description: Balanced, richly sweet-tart. Apricot, cocoa nib, almond, lemon verbena, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with bright, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of cocoa-toned almond and lemon verbena.
Blind Assessment: Balanced, richly sweet-tart. Apricot, cocoa nib, almond, lemon verbena, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with bright, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of cocoa-toned almond and lemon verbena.
Notes: Produced by Kalsada Coffee entirely of the Garnica variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Mostra Coffee is a women-, minority-, veteran-, and immigrant-owned micro-roaster based in north county San Diego. For more information, visit www.mostracoffee.com.
Bottom Line: An inviting washed Philippines cup with depth from cocoa notes and lift from stone fruit and sweet herbs.

Review_Description: Sweetly tart, chocolaty. Pomegranate, baking chocolate, orange zest, almond, oak in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with brisk acidity; plush, chewy mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with undertones of pomegranate and almond.
